column4: May i ask? Is ubuntu a good choice for a Netbook OS? (Currently, I'm running Debian Testing on it, and i want something fresh and fancy)
works just fine, might not want to run gnome/unity though

I prefer a tiler on netbooks. More efficient in regards to screen space, and most importantly, much easier to controll by keyboard, which is somewhat important since the pads on most netbooks are rather crappy

My Debian Testing XFce Setup is very clean, and gives me a lot of space to work with. One of the main reasons i gone to to Debian is that with UNR, i had a thick ugly bar on the left side of my screen. I hope by this tyme they removed that ugly thick bar.
